etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in John Ray (1627–1705), naturalist and theologian. From Golsinny, former variant of the name of a village in western Cornwall (now Goldsithney), with the first element remodelled after gold

definitions: Either of two wrasses of the eastern Atlantic and Mediterranean: the goldsinny wrasse, Ctenolabrus rupestris, and the corkwing wrasse, Symphodus melops.
